description: <p>We have an exciting opportunity in our Ipswich Dialysis Clinic for a dialysis assistant who wants to make a difference in our patient’s lives. Working in partnership with the NHS, you will provide patient care according to Diaverum procedures under the supervision of a registered nurse. A comprehensive professional training programme will be provided to you, including on-the-job training, e-learning and access to our in-house education programme ‘d Academy’.<br /><br />RESPONISIBILITIES:<br />• To support team in the clinic area and to provide care within agreed competencies as per instructed by a registered nurse<br />• Prepare, restore and maintain areas, equipment and clinical supplies in readiness for dialysis<br />• Conduct patient observations pre/post dialysis (blood pressure, weight)<br />• Prepare patients for dialysis – programme machines and connect patients to commence treatment as directed by qualified personnel<br />• Monitor throughout treatment – reporting changing , incidents and patient feedback to responsible nurse<br />• Follow dialysis, complete discontinuation procedures including wash back and removal of needles<br />• Assist with preparation of patient documentation as appropriate<br />• Comply with Company policies and procedures whilst observing statutory requirements –Health+Safety, CPR, manual handling, infection prevention<br />• Ensure ‘great care‘ is provided at all times<br /><br />REQUIREMENTS:<br />• Previous experience working in a care or healthcare environment<br />• Qualified to at least NVQ Level 3 in Health and Social Care (or equivalent)<br />• Be able to work autonomously and within a multi-disciplinary team<br />• Have a positive and dynamic approach to providing safe and effective delivery of care<br />• Excellent communication skills with fluency in English<br /><br />GROW WITH US!<br />• Full Time - 37.5 hours per week<br />• Monday to Saturday, Shifts hours from 06.00 to 24.00 (No Nights or Sunday working)<br />• Pay includes a competitive salary and Unsocial Payments.<br />Relocation allowance*<br />• 27 days annual leave (plus Bank Holidays) increasing with service<br />• Life Assurance, Discounted Fitness/Gym Membership, Auto-Enrolment Company Pension<br />• Post subject to References, Identification, DBS and OH checks <br />* where applicable/dependent on clinic<br /><br />Please note that we reserve the right to close vacancies prior to the advertised closing date when we are in receipt of sufficient applications</p>
title: Dialysis Assistant
